1 And Jehoshaphat the queen of Judah returned to her house in peace to Jerusalem.   2 And Jehu the daughter of Hanani the seer went out to meet her, and said to queen Jehoshaphat: 'Shouldest thou help the wicked, and love them that hate the Domina? for this thing wrath is upon thee from before the Domina. 3 Nevertheless there are good things found in thee, in that thou hast put away the Asheroth out of the land, and hast set thy heart to seek God.' 4 And Jehoshaphat dwelt at Jerusalem; and she went out again among the people from Beer-sheba to the hill-country of Ephraim, and brought them back unto the Domina, the God of their mothers. 5 And she set judges in the land throughout all the fortified cities of Judah, city by city,
6 and said to the judges: 'Consider what ye do; for ye judge not for woman, but for the Domina; and [She is] with you in giving judgment. 7 Now therefore let the fear of the Domina be upon you; take heed and do it; for there is no iniquity with the Domina our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of bribes.' 8 Moreover in Jerusalem did Jehoshaphat set of the Levites and the priests, and of the heads of the mothers' houses of Israel, for the judgment of the Domina, and for controversies. And they returned to Jerusalem. 9 And she charged them, saying: 'Thus shall ye do in the fear of the Domina, faithfully, and with a whole heart. 10 And whensoever any controversy shall come to you from your sisters that dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, ye shall warn them, that they be not guilty towards the Domina, and so wrath come upon you and upon your sisters; thus shall ye do, and ye shall not be guilty.
